intro: Gyrostemon ditrigynus, commonly known as the two-sepal gyrostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-sepal structure in its flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
